title: Trouble with "go run foo.go" on new install. Won't build.
body:
by **deconti.d**: 
Run "go version" and compare against
http://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html  If a newer version of Go exists,
install it and retry what you did to reproduce the problem.

Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. http://play.golang.org/p/duRF5gXJEP
2.
3.

What is the expected output?
hello, world

What do you see instead?
go build fmt: exec: "/home/ddeconti/gosource/pkg/tool/linux_amd64/pack": stat
/home/ddeconti/gosource/pkg/tool/linux_amd64/pack: no such file or directory
go build runtime: exec: "/home/ddeconti/gosource/pkg/tool/linux_amd64/pack":
stat /home/ddeconti/gosource/pkg/tool/linux_amd64/pack: no such file or directory

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?


Which operating system are you using?
Ubuntu Linux 11.10 3.0.0-17-generic

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
version go1

Please provide any additional information below.

Fresh (and first) install of binaries of Go. Untared files to /usr/local/. Added
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin
to my ~/.profile. go build foo.go results in above output instead of actually building
anything. Not certain why it is looking into my home directory for anything.
